sentence.text: A wail more dismal than the bird cries rose up from under the horse .
Helen let out a wail and plunged for her doll .
Their wails and screams rose above the crackle of their burning homes and were made even more blood-curdling by the clangorous din of the church bells that frantically appealed to heaven for aid .
Suddenly the stillness was broken by a distressful wail that came from the other side of the square .
With a wail Jenny threw herself on the bed and buried her face in her pillow .
Across the hall , someone opened the door to the nursery , and the thin wail of a baby cut across her thinking , and she raised her head sharply , feeling a sudden surge of anxiety .
We heard the wail of a siren approaching the hotel , below us .
Dane curled her long body into the remaining space and lay with her head resting on her front paws , oblivious to the pups ' wails of hunger .
But as she did so , she thought she heard a thin , piercing sound , like the wail of a child who has just wakened up and found himself alone .
The echoing impact of boot with pavement broke a silence nearly as terrifying as the noisy wail of the siren earlier , and drew heads to basement windows here and there up Cliveden Place .
At this juncture the peace of the night was rent by the sudden wail of air-raid sirens , and as they started to walk off they bumped into some Italian soldiers .
The black tunnel mouths , the stale warm air , the distant wail of a saxophone : these had become sensations that scarcely penetrated the borders of his awareness .
Sit godless when you hear the religious wail of the telephone
It was almost a wail of anguish .
The banshee-like wail of the wind is majestic .
The wail of alerted police cars filled the night air , Gerald Kaufman left the premises with the help of a fire escape , the fate of the Tory Party being no concern of his .
Below him he could hear the passing wail of sirens , a familiar sound after dark had fallen over the city .
She was the first to hear the distant wail of the ambulance and tapped Madge 's arm reassuringly .
Dauntless cried , which prompted an angry wail from Cleo .
The silence was eased by a long wail from a ship 's hooter from downstream .
Then there is a wail from ahead , a roar and a burst of light ; the face is gone for ever .
There was a wail from the bed and , for the first time since Charles had entered the room , Lesley-Jane spoke .
She gave a piteous wail .
It was a thin , high-pitched wail .
From the bathroom door , Tom let out a wail .
Lina uttered a faint wail .
As they entered the kitchen Christopher let out a wail , ducking his head in towards Alan 's body .
She turned over and gave a loud wail .
Nobody said anything , and Jean waited , agonised , for the baby 's first wail .
Loretta let out a wail , and rushed to the drawing-room .
A whisper went among them , and when the name of the dead man became known , a moaning wail went up , for Sam Gristy was greatly loved .
A woman 's hysterical wail rose above the crackings of the whip .
Yorick screamed again -- the high wail lasted for several seconds before it ended with a sharp report .
A horrible weeping woman with an emaciated face and black teeth , the cyoeraeth 's wail announces the approach of death .
